_header: Into their dark and drublie days

CULLl510.First Lines:
Into þir dirk and deubly dayisquhen sabell all þe heavin
                    arayis…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Then patience sayis be not agasthald hop and trouth within
                    þe fast
CULLl510.Note:
Lines 1-22 only; 1 x 5 mono, 1 x 4 mono, 2 x 5 mono, 1 x 2 mono; then
                        3782 without a
                    break.
CULLl510.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 2.34-5.

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Into þir dirk and drublie dayisQuhone sabill all þe hewin
                    arrayis…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Cum lustie Symmer with þi flowrisThat I may leif in sum
                    Disport
